title: Russia in 'far worse position now' than during 2022 talks | Michael Clarke analysis
description:
Russia is in a "far worse position now" compared to 2022, when direct negotiations with Ukraine last took place, security and defence analyst, Professor Michael Clarke, has been telling Sky News. 

Speaking with talks between Russia and Ukraine underway in Istanbul, Clarke said: "Compared to 2022, the Russians are in a far worse position now than they were then because in 2022, they thought, 'it's only a matter of time before we take the whole country'. "

Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/ukraine-war-latest-peace-talks-zelenskyy-putin-istanbul-crimea-baltic-nato-jet-clarke-frontline-turkey-erdogan-12541713

About " paying the price"  of your actions: 
Russian arms exports in 2023 had fallen 84%, from 8,300 to 1,300 TVI, compared to 2013, the year before the Russian invasion of Crimea and Donbas. In 2012 Russia accounted for about 30% of the world's export value and in 2023 only 4.4%. 
Russia had 31 nations as clients in 2013. In 2023, post-Ukraine invasion, only 3 countries placed orders for new Russian weapons:  Iran, China and Kyrgyzstan. Moreover, a large part of those are not new orders from 2022-2023, but old orders that have been on the table for many years, well before the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Fundamentally, Russia now relies on a single buyer, Teheran, which is under heavy international sanctions and facing double-digit inflation.
Why so?  "The war in Ukraine undermined the reputation of many Russian weapon systems, often demonstrating their ineffectiveness or obsolescence.”

comments.author: @namur-iq6ih
comments.text:
Russia is negotiating from the position of strength due to its obvious successes on the battlefield. Ukraine, in the meantime, desperately needs a ceasefire because it is losing and needs a pause to recover and regroup.

Russia holds all the cards, and Ukraine badly needs a respite.

Russian forces reportedly launched 112 strike drones, primarily of the “Geran” type, targeting Ukrainian infrastructure, including in Kyiv and Odesa. Ukrainian defenses struggled to repel the onslaught, losing another F-16 fighter jet in the process. The pilot ejected safely, but the incident highlights the growing strain on Ukraine’s air capabilities.

On the frontlines, Ukrainian forces renewed attempts to breach Russian defenses in the Kursk region, deploying infantry, mobile units, and even boats to cross the Seym River. Russian troops repelled multiple incursions, destroying armored vehicles and thwarting sabotage groups disguised in Russian uniforms. However, Ukrainian rocket attacks inflicted damage on civilian infrastructure, including a hospital and a church in Tetkino, further escalating tensions.

The Russian offensive continued on Donbass frontlines, with the liberation of Volnoye Pole in the south and sustained pressure on key strongholds like Konstantinovka in the north. Russian victory in Torske near Krasny Liman further weakened Ukrainian positions, with reports indicating severe manpower shortages in defending Ukrainian units.  Russian forces, meanwhile, consolidated gains near Pokrovsk, threatening to envelop Ukrainian defenses along the Kazenny Torets River. Western analysts noted a cascading collapse of Ukrainian defenses in several directions, attributing Russian gains to relentless airstrikes and artillery barrages.

The juxtaposition of ongoing negotiations and escalating combat operations underscores the precarious nature of the conflict. While diplomats are trying to engage in dialogue, the battlefield realities suggest neither side is willing to cede ground without a fight. The coming days will reveal whether the talks in Istanbul can yield tangible de-escalation or if the war will continue to overshadow diplomatic efforts.

This war won't wait for diplomacy.

comments.author: @awesimo4684
comments.text:
Idiots in the comment section think they know how wars work. Lines on maps don't win wars. Napolean occupied Moscow. Moscow!! And it was a complete catastrophe for him. Idiots here would be saying "Russia can't win" back then. Germany held territory inside France for the entire first world war. The front line never budged from the start until the end years later. For four years Germany was entrenched in France, never budging. They lost. The complete fools in the comment section would have been claiming German victory.

Man power, industrial power, and morale wins wars. Russia have less man power, less economic power, and less morale than they did two years ago. In that time, Ukraine has become the world's military drone super power, producing more military drones than any other country, even the USA and China. Ukraine have also developed their own cruise missile capable of hitting as far into Russia as Moscow. What has Russia developed in that time? Nothing. Russia is fighting with the same military tech it started the war with. It started as a military super power vs a plucky underdog. It is now a military super power vs another military super power. Make no mistake, that's what Ukraine is currently.

If the European economy continues to back Ukraine, and there is no sign of it stopping, Russia has absolutely zero chance of winning this war. The only thing that could change that would be the USA or China joining Russia. Europe's economy dwarfs Russia's. People love to point out that Europe buys gas of Russia still. Russia's gas exports have dropped significantly every year since the war began.

comments.author: @wcangel
comments.text:
Michael Clarke is correct.  The Russian diplomatic position [ Istanbul protocol ]  is rejection of Ukraine sovereignty, and Russia is failing badly against the Ukraine Army in Pokrovsk in eastern Ukraine.
Ukraine is getting fighter planes and massive amounts of artillery rounds from the Europeans this year. 
Clarke also correctly states that the Russian soldiers are basically untrained and mostly ineffective.  They are suffering hideous losses, more than three times the losses of Ukraine forces.
Ukraine repeatedly makes deep and crippling strikes within Russia, which Russia never expected and still cannot hold off.
Russia cannot produce sufficient tanks or jet planes for this war.  The Ukraine Army neutralized more than five thousand Russian tanks, and large numbers of their tank crews.
Russia also keeps losing many air defense systems, and these are extremely hard to replace.
Today Russia uses donkeys for Ukraine battlefront logistics, like in the First World War era.
The Russian economy - now in large part a war economy -  is in very bad shape and the Russian war against Ukraine is beginning to fail.
Both sides are suffering hideous losses but Ukraine will still be standing in five years, so what about the future of Russia?
I expect the Russian Federation to fall down and break apart within five years, mainly due to economic collapse and regional nationalist movements.
In short, Ukraine loses a great deal but Russia loses everything.

title: Ukraine war: Putin no show at peace talks in Turkey
description:
The talks in Turkey were supposed to involve the presidents of Ukraine, Russia and possibly the USA. And they were supposed to usher in peace, or at least a ceasefire. Instead, Russia sent some low level officials while Vladimir Putin remained very much at home. 

(Subscribe: https://bit.ly/C4_News_Subscribe) 

Volodymyr Zelenskyy has travelled to Turkey but dismissed the Russian delegation as merely "decorative".  The Russian foreign ministry in turn called him a 'loser and a clown'.

title: Satellite images show Putin massing Russian troops on border with Finland
description:
Satellite images show Putin building up a substantial military presence on the Finnish border.

Images obtained by Swedish broadcaster SVT show four locations have seen a significant increase in activity.

NATO member Finland heavily protects its eastern border.

In 2022, a border fence was erected to provide more defence against a Russian invasion.

Following Finland’s accession to NATO, Kremlin officials threatened ‘military-technical response measures’.

This move shows a worrying war stance being adopted by Putin on Russia’s north-east border.

This is just troop rotation and buildup after Finland dropped its Neutrality posture and joined NATO. This deployment was outlined last year to react to new NATO bases near the Russian Border. The British tabloids' overreaction is really shocking.

Nobody is going to attack Finland, as the Border Dispute was resolved between 1939 and 1945, with Finland losing Lake Ladoga, the Karelia Peninsular, the City of Vyborg, Petsamo, and Sala, and access to the Arctic Ocean.

This was outlined in the Treaty of Moscow in 1945.

So the British Media, as usual, is always trying to stir up rhetoric, like Putin will attack NATO; the British think they need to ramp up Missile Defense as the Russians are planning to attack.

Yes, the Russian Warships were just sailing by and waving hello when they traversed the French Channel on their way to their Mediterranean deployment.

Ukrainian conflict on May 12. Day 1172:
Situation on Chernigov: In the last hours the Russian Army took control over the checkpoint of "Gremyach" in Ukrainian side. This advance should not be understood as a prelude to a new offensive, but as an increase in the buffer zone at the expense of Ukrainian territory.
Situation on Zaporizhia front: During the last two weeks Russian Army made a series of advances in this fronts where it has returned to a battle of positions. Russian Army took full control over the locality of Lobkove & recaptured new positions in the southern part of Kamyanske.
Day 1173:
Situation on Pokrovsk front: Russian Army made significant advances with the complete capture of Novooleksandrivka reaching the outskirts of Novomykolaivka & Solona river (Less than 1 Km from from Dnipropetrovsk oblast) as well as several positions south of it. In addition, Russian forces made new advances in Horikhove (1.2 Km from from Dnipropetrovsk region).
Situation on Velikaya Novoselovka front: Russian Army made new advances between Kostyantynopil & Bahatyr (taking control over the eastern warehouses of this locality & a third of it). Moreover, during the last seven days Russian Army made significant advances towards Odradne taking control over the sector of the main Ukrainian Army defense line in this direction.

comments.text: Ukrainian Ambassador Oleksii Makeiev has welcomed the decision of the new German government to treat arms deliveries to Ukraine as a secret matter again. "A good chess player thinks several moves ahead. What he doesn't do is predict these moves to his opponent," Makeiev told the German Press Agency. "As ambassador of Ukraine, I am privy to such secrets," he added. After Chancellor Friedrich Merz's visit to Kyiv, he was therefore able to confirm: "Germany will deliver. And we know exactly what and when. And we are satisfied." The former Ukrainian ambassador, Andriy Melnyk, had previously criticized Merz for the return to secrecy. "This brings back bad memories of the time when the traffic light government tried to conceal a lack of military support in the spring of 2022 with secrecy," he said.

title: Russia urgently "cancels May 9" after massive Ukrainian drone attack
description:
#Kanal13​ #likekanal13​ #subscribekanal13 #warinukraine
https://www.youtube.com/user/kanal13az?sub_confirmation=1 - SUBSCRIBE TO US!
The aggressor country is urgently changing its plans regarding propaganda events timed to coincide with May 9. Following the massive attack by Ukrainian drones on Russian territory, a wave of cancellations of events planned for the said date has begun in the Russian Federation,  Verstka  writes . The restrictions affected at least Moscow, the Moscow region, the Vladimir, Lipetsk, Vologda regions and Mordovia. Thus, in Yegoryevsk, the memorial service for the victims was moved from the cemetery to the church "for safety reasons." In Ramenskoye, a school performance was cancelled, and in the Pavlovsky Posad District, evening concerts were cancelled, while car rallies and flower-laying ceremonies were retained. In the Vladimir region, the Immortal Regiment march and an evening concert have been cancelled in Kirzhach due to the "threat of a UAV crash". Similar measures have been taken in the Lipetsk region, where events have been postponed indefinitely and some events have been transferred to an online format. In Mordovia, the gala concert has been postponed to May 15 – officially due to "Internet restrictions." In the Vologda Region, bad weather was cited as the reason for postponing the events. In addition, performances by Russian artists who were unable to fly out of the Russian capital due to flight delays are being cancelled. 

Recall, Russia’s Defense Ministry has claimed its air defenses destroyed about 524 Ukrainian drones in a single day during what it called the most massive drone attack to date. The figure came after pro-war Russian military bloggers reported a record drone and missile assault on Russia overnight into May 7. The Z-affiliated Telegram channel Voevoda Veshchaet stated that 447 long-range drones and missiles had struck Russia between the evening of May 6 and early hours of May 7. The bloggers described it as the largest drone attack since the start of Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine. During the night, Russian Telegram channels tracked swarms of drones headed toward Moscow via Ryazan, Tula and Oryol oblasts. Residents in the Moscow suburbs of Yegoryevsk and Kolomna reported hearing the sound of UAVs and explosions.

By morning, Russian airlines had begun mass cancellations and flight mergers, citing disruptions caused by the drone attacks.

Andrii Kovalenko, head of Ukraine’s Center for Counteracting Disinformation at the National Security and Defense Council, said a number of high-value targets within Russia’s military-industrial complex had been hit.

In Saransk, a fiber-optic systems plant was struck. In Tula, the attack targeted the Instrument Design Bureau. Another target was the Splav enterprise, a key developer of multiple launch rocket systems for the Russian military.

title: North Korea confirms it sent troops to fight for Russia in Ukraine war | BBC News
description:
North Korea has for the first time confirmed that it sent troops to fight for Russia against Ukraine.
 
In a report on state news agency KCNA, Pyongyang's military claimed its soldiers helped Russian forces "completely liberate" the Kursk border region, according to an order given by leader Kim Jong Un.
 
Pyongyang's announcement comes just days after Russian Chief of Staff Valery Gerasimov praised the "heroism" of North Korean troops, the first time Moscow has publicly acknowledged their involvement.
 
Western officials had earlier told the BBC they believed at least 1,000 of the 11,000 troops sent from North Korea had been killed over three months.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#NorthKorea  #Russia #Ukraine #BBCNews

comments.text:
A Plan for the USA and England to Stand Up to Global Threats

Here’s a detailed, down-to-earth plan for how the USA and England (as part of the UK) can team up to tackle big global adversaries like Russia, China, and North Korea. This isn’t just about power—it’s about protecting people, supporting Ukraine, and making the world a safer place. We’ll cover military moves, economic punches, and diplomatic teamwork, all while keeping it human and real.



Military Strategies: Showing Strength, Protecting Lives

The USA and England have a long history of standing together when the going gets tough. Here’s how they can flex their military might—not to start fights, but to stop them before they spiral out of control:





Backing Eastern Europe
Picture families in places like Poland or Latvia, worried about Russia stirring trouble nearby. The USA and England can send more troops and top-notch missile defenses to Eastern Europe, working hand-in-hand with NATO. Joint training with local forces would be like a loud message to Russia: “We’re here, we’re united, and we’re not messing around.”



Arming Ukraine with What They Need
Ukraine’s people are fighting for their homes—think of the courage it takes to stand up to a giant like Russia. The USA and England can supply them with advanced weapons, like long-range missiles, to push back Russian forces. Sharing real-time intelligence would be like giving Ukraine a map to navigate the chaos, helping them protect their kids and communities.



Getting Ukraine into NATO, Fast
Ukraine wants in on NATO, and why wouldn’t they? It’s like joining a big family that’s got your back. The USA and England can lead the charge to speed this up, making it clear that if Russia attacks a NATO member, they’re taking on the whole team. That’s a line in the sand Putin won’t want to cross.



Keeping China in Line in the Indo-Pacific
China’s been eyeing places like Taiwan, acting like they own the neighborhood. The USA and England can boost naval patrols and air support in the South China Sea and Taiwan Strait, teaming up with allies like Japan and Australia. It’s like keeping an eye on the street to make sure no one gets out of hand—stronger together.



Stopping North Korea’s Bluster
North Korea keeps lobbing missiles like it’s a game. The USA and England can work with South Korea and Japan, setting up better missile defenses—like catching those missiles before they cause harm. Quiet cyber moves could also mess with North Korea’s plans, like flipping off their lights when they least expect it.



Economic Strategies: Hitting the Wallet Hard

Money keeps these adversaries going, so the USA and England can use their economic clout to turn the tables. Here’s how:





Cutting Russia’s Cash Flow
Russia’s war depends on selling oil and gas. The USA and England can tighten sanctions to choke that off, making it harder for Putin to fund his aggression. They can also lean on countries like India or China, saying, “You’re either with us or with him—choose wisely.” Kicking Russia out of global finance is like taking away their credit card.



Breaking Europe’s Reliance on Russian Gas
Imagine European families stuck in the cold because Russia controls their energy. The USA can ship more natural gas to Europe, while England pushes for wind and solar projects. It’s like helping a friend grow their own food instead of begging from the enemy.



Putting the Squeeze on China
China’s been bending trade rules for years. The USA and England can hit them with tariffs and block their access to Western tech—like telling them, “Play fair or sit out.” Moving factories to friendly countries would create jobs elsewhere and loosen China’s hold.



Keeping North Korea Broke
North Korea dodges sanctions like it’s a sport. The USA and England can team up with allies to close those loopholes, especially with China, cutting off Kim’s cash for weapons. No money, no missiles—it’s that simple.



Diplomatic Strategies: Teaming Up to Win

Sometimes talking—or not talking—can be just as powerful as fighting. Here’s how the USA and England can lead with smarts:





Boxing Out Russia and China
Think of Russia and China as the troublemakers everyone’s tired of. The USA and England can pull together NATO, the EU, and allies like Japan and India to freeze them out. Sweetening the deal with trade or aid for countries like Brazil could peel them away from the bad guys—it’s like building a club no one wants to miss.



Cheering Ukraine On, Worldwide
Ukraine’s fight is everyone’s fight. The USA and England can rally the world to send more weapons, cash, and rebuilding help—think of it as a global fundraiser for freedom. Pushing Europe to ditch Russian gas for good would keep the momentum going.



Handling North Korea Carefully
North Korea’s tricky, like a wild card. The USA and England can keep quiet talks going, nudging Kim to drop his nukes, while piling on pressure with South Korea and Japan. It’s a carrot-and-stick approach—firm but open to change.



Leading the World as a Team
Picture Trump—or any leader—calling the shots like a coach, getting everyone on the same page. The USA and England can spearhead this, showing the world how to stand tall. It’s not just about being tough—it’s about inspiring others to join in.



Ukraine and the World: One Big Fight





Ukraine’s Role
Ukraine’s the little engine that could, battling for their land and their lives. With the USA and England’s help—weapons, intel, NATO—they can keep going. Every day they resist, they prove freedom’s worth fighting for.



The World’s Part
This isn’t just Ukraine’s war—it’s a wake-up call. The USA and England can get Europe, Asia, and beyond to crank up the pressure on Russia, China, and North Korea. Cut their money, stop their weapons, break their support—it’s like the whole world saying, “We’re done with this.”



Wrapping It Up: Tough, Smart, and Human

The USA and England have the muscle, the brains, and the heart to pull this off. It’s not about starting wars—it’s about stopping them by arming Ukraine, hitting Russia and China where it hurts, and leading a world that’s had enough of bullies. This is for the Ukrainian mom who just wants her kids safe, the European worker who needs heat in winter, the Asian kid who deserves a peaceful tomorrow. Together, they can make it happen—and show the world what strength really looks like.

3. God loves us, He does not want us to go to Hell, He provided a way for our escape from Hell - (Rom. 5:8) But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.









* Because of God's love for us, He sent his only son Jesus Christ to die in our place on the cross. Jesus Christ took all the weight of our sins so we can be saved through grace, NOT our works.









* The blood that Jesus shed on the cross can wash away our sins and make us clean









4. Through Jesus Christ, we can now have eternal life in HEAVEN - (Rom. 6:23b) but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.









*Gift - free, but you can only have it if you receive it. If you reject it then the punishment of Hell is waiting for you









5. How can I receive eternal life? - (Rom. 10:9) That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved. 









* You have to admit you are a sinner and you cannot save yourself from Hell nor go to Heaven through your own efforts.








 You have to believe in your heart that Jesus Christ died on the cross for your sins, was buried and rose again after 3 days and that He and only He can save you from hell.









(Roman 10:13) For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.  









* Whosoever means anyone including me and you! 









Do you want to do it? Pray this prayer:









Dear God, I admit I am a sinner and cannot save myself from hell. I believe that Jesus Christ died for my sins, was buried and rose again. I believe that only  Jesus Christ can save me from Hell and He is the only way to Heaven.  I accept Jesus Christ in my heart as my Lord and Savior. Thank You for eternal life. Amen.

오셨습니다(마태복음4:17,23) 천국복음을 전파하시며 비유로서 말씀을 전파하셨습니다(마태복음13:10~17) 그러므로 여기 말씀에서 바람은 전쟁을 비유했습니다(예례미야4:11~13,19) 바다는 인류세상을 비유했습니다(요한계시록17:15) 나무는 나라를 뜻합니다(에스겔20:47~49) 그리고 이스라엘 각 지파중에 이스라엘은 팔레스타인 지역에 거주하는 육적인 유대인들이 아니라 신약시대에서는 대저 표면적 유대인이 유대인이 아니라 이면적 유대인이 유대인이라 하신 말씀처럼 영적인 유대인들을 뜻합니다(로마서2:28~29) 그리고 또 이 일 후는 요한계시록6:13 하늘에 별들이 무화과 나무가 대풍에 흔들려 선 과실이 떨어지는 것같이 땅에 떨어지며. 여기 말씀에서 하늘에 별들과 무화과 나무는 이스라엘 백성들을 상징합니다(창세기15:5,누가복음13:6~7)  그러므로 하늘에 별들이 무화과 나무가 대풍에(큰전쟁) 흔들려 선 과실이 땅에 떨어진다는 뜻은 2차 세계대전때 나치 독일에 의해 유대인들이 600만 명이 희생이 된 것을 예수님께서 계시로서 보여주고 있습니다 그리고 14절에 하늘은 종이 축이 말리는 것같이 떠나가고 이 말씀의 뜻은 예수님께서 핵이 폭발하는 장면을 보여주고 있습니다 2차 세계대전때 일본에 핵이 떨어져 폭발했습니다 그러므로 요한계시록7장 1절에 이 일 후는 2차 세계대전이 되는 것입니다 2차 세계대전 후에 네 천사가 동서남북 사방에 바람을(2차세계대전) 붙잡고 있는 이유는 전세계에 있는 하나님의 백성들에 이마에 하나님의 인을 처 구원하기 위함입니다 이 일이 다 끝나면 그때는 천사가 잡고 있는 사방에 바람을(2차세계대전) 놓으므로 이땅에 3차 세계대전이 일어나게 되는 것입니다 그러므로 우리는 이 날에 구원에 참여 하기 위하여 하나님의 인침을 받아야 하는 것입니다 그렇다면 과연 하나님의 인은 무엇인가? 요한복음6:27, 53~56 썩는 양식을 위하여 일하지 말고 영생하도록 있는 양식을 위하여 하라 이 양식은 인자가(예수님) 너희에게 주리니 인자는 아버지 하나님의 인친😅 자니라. 예수께서 이르시되 내가 진실로 진실로 너희에게 이르노니 인자의 살을 먹지 아니하고 인자의 피를 마시지 아니하면 너희 속에 생명이 없느니라 내 살을 먹고 내 피를 마시는 자는 영생을 가졌고 마지막 날에 내가 그를 다시 살리리니 내 살은 참된 양식이요 내 피는 참된 음료로다 내 살을 먹고 내 피를 마시는 자는 내 안에 거하고 나도 그 안에 거하나니. 여기 말씀에서 예수님의 몸 자체가 하나님의 인침을 받았으므로 영생하시는 예수님의 살과피를 먹고 마시므로서 예수님이 내 안에 내가 예수님 안에 거하게 되므로 예수님과 한몸이 되여 나 또한 하나님의 인침을 받게 되고 영생을 얻게 되는 것입니다 그렇다면 예수님의 살과피를 어떻게 먹고 마실수가 있을까요? 마태복음26:19 제자들이 예수에 시키신 대로 하여 유월절을 예비하니라. 유월절을 에비했다면 지키는 장면을 봅시다 마태복음26:26~28 저희가 먹을때에 에수께서 떡을 가지사 축복하시고 떼어 제자들을 주시며 가라사대 너희가 다 이것을 마시라 이것은 죄사함을 얻게 하려고 많은 사람을 위하여 흘리는 바 나의 피 곧 언약의 피니라. 예수님께서 피를 흘리셨다면 십자가에서 피를 흘리셨습니다 그런데 유월절에 포도주를 십자가에서 흘리는 피 나의 피라고 말씀하셨습니다 그러므로 유월절에 떡은 십자가에 달리신 예수님의 몸이 되고 또 우리가 유월절에 떡과 포도주를 먹고 마시므로 예수님의 살과피를 먹고 마시게 되므로 예수님과 한몸이 되니 하나님의 인침을 받고 영생을 얻고 또 예수님께서는 유월절을 지켜 자신과 한몸이 된 우리에 죄를 위하려 십자가에서 희생에 피를 흘리심으로서 유월절 지켜 에수님과 한몸된 우리에 죄가 용서받게 되는 것입니다 다시말해 유월절 날에 떡과포도주를 먹고 마시므로서 예수님과 한몸이 되여 하나님의 인침을 받고 영생을 얻고 죄사함을 받게되니 재앙이 가까이 우리에게 못오는 것입니다 그러므로 유월절에 뜻은 재앙이 넘어간다해서 유월절입니다 그런데 세상에 교회들과 사람들은 하나님의 인침을 받고 영생을 얻고 죄사함을 받을수 있는 진리 유월절에 대하여 알지도 못하고 지키지도 않고 있습니다 단지 레오나르도 다빈치의 최후에 만찬이라고 알고 있을 뿐입니다 우리 머리에 손을 얹고 생각을 해 봅시다 예수님께서 인류에 죄를 위하여 십자가에서 희생에 피를 흘리심으로 하나님의 인침을 받고 영생을 얻고 죄사함을 받을수 있는 진리 유월절을 세워주셨는데 지키지도 않고 죄사함도 받지 않았으면서 무조건 믿기만 하면 구원을 받는다고 하는 것은 마귀들의 마취약입니다 우선 먼저 유월절 지키고 죄사함을 받고 그 다음에 믿음으로 구원을 받는 것이 옳은 믿음입니다 그리고 또 어느 거짓교회 목사나 신부가 아무때나 주는 떡과 포도주는 절때 예수님의 살과피가 될수없습니다 에덴동산에 선악과가 독이 있어서 아담과 하와가 먹고 죽은것이 아니라 하나님의 말씀에 먹으면 정녕 죽으리라(창세기2:16~17) 말씀하신 그 말씀에 능력때문에 죽은것 처럼 예수님께서 유월절에 떡과 포도주가 내 살과 피라고 말씀하신 말씀에 능력때문에 유월절의 포도주가 예수님의 살과피가 될수있는 것입니다 누가복음22:15 이르시되 내가 고난을 받기 전에 너희와 함께 이 유월절 먹기를 원하고 원하였노라. 왜 에수님께서 유월절 먹기를 원하고 원하였노라 말씀하셨냐면 유월절이 아니고서는 당신에 살과피를 당신에게 먹여 줄수가 없기 때문입니다 제1유월절은 성력으로 정월14일 밤에 기념하는 절기입니다 양력으로는 4월12일입니다 제2유월절은 양력으로 5월12일입니다(레위기23:5 역대하30:1~3) 유월절 지키로 오세요 우리 유월절을 지켜 하나님의 인침을 받아 마지막 날에 하나님께서 이세상을 3차 핵 전쟁에 불로서 심판하시는 날에 구원에 참여 하는 지혜로운 사람이 됩시다 말라기4:1~3 만군에 여호와가 이르노라 보라 극렬한 풀무불 같은 날이 이르리니 교만한 자와 악을 행하는 자는 다 초개같을 것이라......내 이름을 경외하는 너희에게는 의로운 해가 떠 올라서 치료하는 광선을 발하리니 너희가 나가서 외양간에서 나온 송아지 같이 뛰리라 또 너희가 악인을 밟을 것이니 그들은 나의 정한 날에 너희 발바닥 밑에 재와같으리라 만군에 여호와의 말이니라. 이땅에 핵이 폭발하면 악을 행하는 자와 교만한 자는 모두 극렬한 풀무불에 불살라 없어질 것입니다 악인이란 유월절에 죄사함을 허락하셨는데 지키지 않았으니 죄사함을 받지 못해 의인이 아니라 악인들이고 또 유월절을 무시하고 지킬 필요가 없다고 하는 자들이 바로 교만한 자들입니다 사람이 죽은 후에 영혼이 또 심판을 받고 극렬한 지옥 풀무불 속으로 떨어질 것입니다(마태복음13:42~43, 히브리서9:27 한 번 죽는 것은 사람에게 정하신 것이요 그 후에는 심판이 있으리니) 내가 왜 심판을 받고 지옥으로 떨어져야 하는 가련한 운명인지 지금 깨닫고 구원을 준비해야 합니다 YouTube 에서 the church of God visitors from the angelic world 설교 말씀을 들어 보시고요 또the passover is the way and the truth 설교 말씀을 들어 보시고요 우리 하나님의 교회(www.watv.org) 직접 방문해 주시거나 아니면 우리 전도인들을 집으로 초대해 주시면 하나님의 인 유월절에 대하여 더 자세하게 알려들이겠습니다 comments.author: @trofimlysenko-d6i
comments.text:
Flashback 1994 Budapest Memorandum

On December 5, 1994, leaders of the United States, the United Kingdom, and the Russian Federation met in Budapest, Hungary, to pledge security assurances to Ukraine in connection with its accession to the Treaty on the Nonproliferation of Nuclear Weapons (NPT) as a non-nuclear-weapons state. The signature of the so-called Budapest Memorandum concluded arduous negotiations that resulted in Ukraine’s agreement to relinquish the world’s third-largest nuclear arsenal, which the country inherited from the collapsed Soviet Union, and transfer all nuclear warheads to Russia for dismantlement. The signatories of the memorandum pledged to respect Ukraine’s territorial integrity and inviolability of its borders, and to refrain from the use or threat of military force. Russia breached these commitments with its annexation of Crimea in 2014 and aggression in eastern Ukraine, bringing the meaning and value of security assurance pledged in the Memorandum under renewed scrutiny.

comments.text: 구원이 하나님께로부터 옵니다 이 처럼 마지막 날에 이 세상을 불로서 심판 하시는 이도 역시 하나님입니다  구원이 이스라엘 나라에서 시작하여 전세계 모든 나라로 전파가 된것 처럼 하나님의 마지막 불심판 3차 핵 전쟁이 이스라엘 나라가 있는 중동에서 시작 하여 전세계 모든 나라로 확전이 될 것입니다 즉 구원이 시작이 되는 곳에서 멸망이 시작이 될 것입니다 2처년 전에 에수님께서 이스라엘 나라에 오셔서 유대인들이게 회개하라고 외쳤지만 오히려 성도들을 핍박을 하고 죽이고 또 예수님까지 십자가에 못박아 죽게했습니다 유대인들은 왜 그랬을까요 그 이유는 요한복음5:36......이 성경이 곧 내게(예수님) 대하여 증거하는 것이로다. 모세를 믿었더면 또 나를 믿었으리니 이는 그가 내게 대하여 기록했음이로다 그러나 그의 글도 믿지 아니하거든 어찌 내 말을 믿겠느냐 하시니라. 여기 말씀에서 모세의 글이란 모세5경 창세기 출에굽기 레위기 민수기 신명기입니다 이곳에 모세가 예수님에 대하여 기록했지만  유대인들이 모세5경을(성경) 믿지 아니하니 어찌 성경이 증거하는 나를 믿겠느냐 라고 예수님꼐서 유대인들을 질책하시는 장면입니다 이 당시에 유대인들은 겉으로는 성경을 가지고 하나님을 믿는 것처럼 보였으나 실상은 성경에 예언을 믿지 않아 성경이 증거하는 예수님을 십자가에 못박아 죽게하면서 그 피를 우리와 우리 자손들에게 돌릴찌어다(마태복음27:25) 라고 망령된 말을 합니다 그결과 누가복음21:20~24 너희가 예루살렘이 군대들에게 에워싸이는 것을 보거든 그 멸망이 가까운 줄을 알라......저희가 칼날에 죽임을 당하며 모든 이방에 사로잡혀 가겠고........이러한 예언을 따라 이스라엘 나라는 AD70년에 로마제국에 침공으로 110만 명이 죽임을 당하고 9만 7천 명이 포로로 잡혀 갔다고 합니다 그러나 예수님을 믿었던 하나님의 백성들은 예수님의 말씀을 따라 미리 펠라성으로 피신하여 구원을 받았다고 합니다 예수님을 십자가에 못박아 죽게하면서 그 피를 우리와 우리 자손들에게 돌릴찌어다 라고 외친 유대인들의 함성은 결국에는 로마제국에 침공으로 자기들에게 피값이 돌아가고 또 나치 독일에 의해 600만 명의 유대인들이 학살이 되여 자기들의 후손들에게 예수님의 피값이 돌아갔다고 합니다 이 모두가 성경에 예언의 성취라 하겠습니다 그럼 우리는 왜 유대인들이 회개치 않아 전쟁으로 멸망한 이들의 과거 역사에 대하여 알아야 하냐면 하나님께서는 세상 만민중에 유대민족을 택하사 이들을 성경에 중심인물로서 세워서 세상에 만민에게 하나님의 뜻을 알리고 있는 것입니다 유대민족이 회개치 않아 전쟁으로 멸망한 것은 거울이 되여 전세계 모든 민족이 3차 핵 전쟁으로 멸망 할 것을 예언과 예언의 성취관계로서 우리에게 알려주고 있는 것입니다 그렇다면 예수님께서 다시 초라한 목수의 아들처럼 사람되여 다시 재림하신다면 이세상에 사람들이 성경에 예언을 믿고 구원자로서 영접할까요? 요한복음1:5 빛이 어두움에 비취되 어두움이 깨닫지 못하더라. 빛이란 하나님의 말씀을 깨닫고 그리스도를 알아 볼수있는 진리의 빛을 뜻합니다 빛을 예언으로 보지 않고 그냥 육신으로 보면 그냥 태양빛입니다 아침에 태양이 동쪽 땅 끝에서 떠 올라서 온 세상에 비추이는 것처럼 재림그리스도께서는 이스라엘 나라를 기준으로 해 뜨는 동방 땅끝나라 대한민국에 재림하셨습니다 하나님께서는 실제와 맞지 않는 비유는 하지 않으십니다 그리고 이스라엘 나라가 1900년 동안 나라없이 유랑민으로 지내다가 1948년에 독립하는 이때부터 다시 재림그리스도는 천국복음을 해 뜨는 동방 땅끝나라 대한민국에서부터 온 세상에 전파하기 시작을 했습니다 모든 사람들이 이스라엘 나라에 독립은 기적이라고 말을 합니다 그것은 이미 성경에 예언이 되였기 때문에 이루어진 일이고 또 유대인들이게 기적을 일으켜 이들에 나라를 다시 찾게하신 하나님의 뜻은 그리스도의 재림을 온 세상에 알리는 동시에 이제 인류가 3차 핵 전쟁으로 멸망할 날이 얼마 남지 않음을 우리에게 알려주고 있는 것입니다 이러한 예언을 따라  이땅에 오신 재림그리스도는 안상홍님입니다 지금 세계적으로 기독교 인구가 크게 감소하고 있지만 지금 전세계에 많은나라 사람들이 성경에 예언된 재림그리스도에 대한 예언을 개닫고 안상홍님을 재림그리스도로서 영접하여 하나님의 교회로 몰려오고 있습니다 179개국 이상의 나라에 안상홍님이 재림그리스도라는 예언이 전파가 되였고 7800개 이상의 하나님의 교회가 전세계에 세워졌습니다 이사야29:9~14 너희는 놀라고 놀라라......그들의 취함이 포도주로 인함이 아니며......대저 여호와께서 깊이 잠들게 하는 신을 너희에게 부어주사 너희에 눈을 감기셨음이니 눈은 선지자요........그러므로 모든 묵시가 마치 너희에게는 봉한책에 말이라.....그들이 나를 경외함은 사람에 게명으로 가르침을 받았을 뿐이라 그러므로 내가 이 백성중에 기이한 일 곧 기이하고도 가장 기이한 일을 다시 행하리니 그들중에 지혜자의 지혜가 없어지고 명철자의 총명이 가리워지리라. 모든 성경은 하나님의 감동으로 된 책입니다(디모데후서3:16) 그러므로 하나님의 계명이 아닌 사람에 계명을 지키는 자들에 눈을 감기시니 또 눈이 선지자가 되니 하나님의 말씀을 깨닫지 못해 영적인 소경이 되는 것입니다 마태복음15:1~14......외식하는 자들아 이사야가 너희에게 대하여 잘 예언하였도다 일렀으되 이 백성이 입술로는 나를 존경하나 그 마음은 내게서 멀도다 사람에 계명으로 교훈을 삼아 나를 가르치니 나를 헛되이 경배하는도다......그냥 두어라 저희는 소경이 되여 소경을 인도하는 자로다 만일 소경이 소경을 인도하면 둘이다 구덩이에 빠지리라 하신데. 예수님께서도 역시 사람에 계명을 지키는 자들이 소경된 인도자들 이라고 교훈해 주고 있습니다 그렇다면 오늘날에 소경된 인도자들은 누구 일까요?  일요일에배 크리스마스 십자가 이런것은 태양신 숭배자들이 태양신에게 숭배하기 위하여 만든 사람에 계명입니다 그러므로 이런것을 교회에 세우고 지키는 자들이 바로 소경된 인도자들입니다 그러므로 이들의 교훈을 듣고 따라가면 같이 구덩이에 빠져 지옥으로 떨어지계됩니다 그리고또 이들이 주장하기를 예수님께서 재림하시면 자기들은 구원받아 천국에 들어가고 이 세상은 멸망한다는 교훈은 잘못된 것입니다 요한계시록7:1~3 이 일 후에(2차세계대전후에) 내가 네 천사가 땅 네 모퉁이에 선 것을 보니 땅에 사방에 바람을 붙잡아 바람으로 하여금 땅에나 바다에나 각종 나무에 불지 못하게 하더라 또 보매 다른 천사가 살아계신 하나님의 인을 가지고 해 돋는 데로부터 올라외서 땅과 바다를 해롭게 할 권세를 얻은 네 천사를 향하여 큰 소리로 외쳐 가로되 우리가 우리 하나님의 종들에 이마에 인치기까지 땅이나 바다나 나무를 해하지 말라 하더라. 여기 말씀에서 바람은 전쟁을 뜻합니다(예례미야4:11~13,19) 바다는 인류세상을 뜻합니다(요한계시록17:15) 그리고 나무는 나라를 뜻합니다(에스겔20:47~49) 어느 한쪽에서 부는 전쟁이 아니라 동서남북 사방에서 부는 전쟁이므로 2차 세계대전입니다 2차 세계대전 이후에 해 돋는 동방 땅끝나라 대한민국에서부터 재림그리스도께서는 30세 되는 해인 1948년부터 하나님의 인치는 일을 시작하시여 지금은 전세계 179개국 이상의 나라에서 하나님의 인치는 일이 진행이 되고 있습니다 그리고 재림그리스도 안상홍님께서는 예언따라 이미 하늘로 올리워 가셨고 하나님의 인치는 일이 다 끝나면 천사가 잡고 있는 사방에 바람을(2차세계대전) 놓으므로 이땅에 3차 세계대전이 일어나게 되는 것입니다 초림예수님께서 오신 지역 중동에 화약고 보다 재림그리스도 안상홍님께서 오신 대한민국은 동북아시아 지역으로 세계 최대에 화약고가 있는 지역입니다 그러므로 재림그리스도 안상홍님께서 다시 강림하심으로서 이 세상에 하나님의 인침을 받지 않은 사람들을 마지막 3차 핵 전쟁에 불로서 심판하실 것입니다(에스겔9:1~6) 사람에 계명을 지키는 자들은 예수님의 재림과 강림을 구분을 못합니다 YouTube에서 dose Jesus' second coming refer to the last judgment? 그리고 또 the parable of fig tree & christ Ahnsahnhong 설교만씀을 들어 보시고요 우리 하나님의교회(www.watv.org) 직접 방문해 주시거나 아니면 우리 전도인들을 집으로 초대해 주시면 재림그리스도 안상홍님에 대하여 더 자세하게 알려들이겠습니다 감사합니다. 댓글올린이:장병길, 생명번호:C03-980404-1559

comments.text:
Strategic Call for Global Cooperation to Strengthen Ukraine's Autonomous Defense Capabilities
Esteemed Leaders, Innovators, and Partners,

In the face of ongoing global challenges and escalating hybrid threats, it is imperative to act decisively. One of the most impactful ways to support Ukraine today is by massively scaling the production and advancement of unmanned systems — drones, robotics, and AI- and AGI-driven missile technologies — in both volume and diversity of modifications. Machines must engage in warfare, while humans are preserved and protected.

This technological acceleration must primarily be rooted in Ukraine, while international cooperation should be established based on each country's strengths:

The United Kingdom's Rolls-Royce, a global leader in aerospace propulsion, could cooperate with Ukraine’s Yuzhmash, renowned for its rocket and aerospace engineering capabilities, to jointly develop next-generation engines for aerospace and defense.

Japan, a world leader in robotics, can build strategic partnerships with Ukrainian robotics manufacturers, enhancing both nations’ capabilities through collaboration and joint development projects.

Germany, with its premier robotics institutes, could provide research and engineering synergies with Ukraine’s defense technology initiatives.

The United States, leading in Artificial Intelligence, particularly through institutions like DeepMind Robotics, is pioneering AGI — enabling AI systems to understand both natural language and computer vision while controlling robotic manipulators. These advances should be integrated into Ukraine’s defense sector to achieve full autonomy in battlefield robotics.

By connecting Ukraine to such "technological modules," a mutually beneficial exchange of expertise, technology, and real-world testing will be realized, catalyzing innovation on both sides.

Moreover, the development of autonomous, intelligent swarms of drones and robotic systems capable of independent decision-making will drastically change the dynamics of modern defense. AI must be trained to coordinate diverse robotic platforms, enabling seamless and adaptive battlefield cooperation — learning through reinforcement to avoid past mistakes and improve over time.

This is the future that Ukraine, together with its allies, must build:

A fully integrated, autonomous defense ecosystem based on collective strength, innovation, and unwavering strategic vision.

Urgency is critical. China, Russia, and their allies are actively developing similar systems at high speed. This is not merely a technological race — it is a marathon of resilience and supremacy. We are already witnessing a "new Cold War" with increasingly "hot" elements, impacting the future global balance.

Delays by Ukraine’s allies will only provide China and Russia with greater opportunities to strengthen their positions.
The time to act boldly and cooperatively is now.

Together, through decisive innovation and strategic alliances, we can ensure that the future is protected by the forces of freedom, intelligence, and humanity.

title: Xi's Troops To Help Putin's Men In Ukraine War? China Military Says 'Ready To Strengthen...'
description:
China has said that it is ready to "expand practical cooperation" with the Russian army. The announcement comes days after Chinese president Xi Jinping visited Moscow to attend the Victory Day Parade presided by Russia president Vladimir Putin. Jinping's Moscow visit was condemned by Ukraine's allies, who accused Beijing of giving Moscow economic and political cover to wage a war of aggression.

title: Trump, Zelensky Shocked? Putin Gives Stunning Answer On 'Reunifying' Ukrainian Parts Into Russia
description:
Just days before the May 9 Victory Day parade, Russian President Vladimir Putin stuns the world by calling reconciliation with Ukraine “inevitable.” In a dramatic documentary interview, Putin blames the West for betrayal over the Minsk accords and claims the Ukraine war is nearing a “logical conclusion.” As Zelensky warns foreign leaders against visiting Moscow, Putin’s comments fuel speculation of a major shift. Is peace possible—or a bigger war coming?

INTERNATIONAL NEWS

#Putin #Ukraine #VictoryDay #Peace #RussiaUkraineWar #Zelensky #Ceasefire

comments.author: @alikbahshi1879
comments.text:
Alik Bakhshi

A slowpoke from the White House

Donald Trump, literally in the first days of his presidency, promised to stop the bloodshed in Ukraine and save thousands of people from death. As a thrifty owner and businessman, for whom America is above all else, Trump was concerned about America's spending on military aid to Ukraine. He did not care at all under what conditions the war would stop and a peace treaty would be signed between the aggressor and the victim. I believe Trump planned to benefit from the peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine. Having already had experience communicating with Putin, and apparently knowing him as a smart and calculating politician, Trump decided to put pressure on Zelensky first and invited him to the White House in the hope that under the threat of ending military aid, he would be able to persuade the young green politician to make concessions. However, Trump was very wrong, Zelensky surprisingly turned out to be a tough nut to crack, who made it clear to the American businessman that he was not going to trade Ukrainian territory.

However, Zelensky's unsuccessful visit also had a positive side for Ukraine, because against the backdrop of Trump's threat to interrupt arms supplies to Ukraine, EU countries realized the need to ensure Ukraine's victory in its war with fascist Russia on their own. And after three months, Trump also realized the futility of simply persuading to end the bloodshed. Moreover, in order not to look like a lost sheep, Trump abandoned his threat to suspend arms supplies to Ukraine. At the same time, on May 12, European leaders and Trump issued an ultimatum demanding a ceasefire along the entire front line for 30 days and to begin peace talks without delay, otherwise tougher sanctions would be imposed on Russia. Trump promised to transfer weapons to Ukraine in quantities sufficient to defeat the Russian army if Putin refused direct negotiations.

It seems that this time Putin, who had been counting on a split between America and the EU, was seriously scared for the first time, so much so that without waiting for the next day, he urgently gathered his servants at 2 a.m. and announced his intention to start direct negotiations with Ukraine on May 15 in Istanbul. However, Putin did not say a word about a 30-day truce. Zelensky, in turn, immediately announced his readiness for a personal meeting with Putin. Here Putin, without expecting it, fell into a trap that he himself had set. It must be said that Putin avoided any debates and, unlike other presidential contenders, never took part in them during the election campaign. It is not difficult to foresee that during a face-to-face meeting, the former comedian showman will devour him alive, especially in the presence of Erdogan and Trump himself, who could not miss an opportunity to get some extra PR, who made him want to fly to such a significant event. Such a prospect was clearly not in the calculation of the Kremlin dictator. Well, what can he tell the whole world - I want war? After all, only war, and preferably a victorious one, reliably ensures his stay on the royal throne. Peace in the current circumstances is like death for Putin. The Russian people, impoverished by the war, with their imperial worldview, will not forgive the Fuhrer for his unfulfilled dreams of reviving the empire and the many thousands of soldiers who died in vain. Naturally, Putin at the last moment refused to meet with Zelensky and belatedly sent negotiators to Istanbul who do not have any authority, with the sole purpose of dragging out these negotiations for as long as possible.

How this childishly naive trick of Putin will be perceived depends entirely on Trump, who, I hope, will finally understand his mistake in thinking that the war can be stopped through negotiations without defeating the aggressor. Trump could have really saved thousands of lives if, upon entering the White House, he had not repeated Biden's mistake of supplying weapons in small doses, but had immediately ordered the transfer of weapons to Ukraine in the quantities necessary for victory. Only a convincing victory for Ukraine can thwart Putin's revanchist plans to restore the Russian Empire within the borders of the Soviet Union.

05/16/2025

title: Abrams and Leopard vs. Russian Tank T-90M. Western Tanks in the War in Ukraine
description:
Western tanks — Leopard 2, Abrams M1, Challenger 2 — and the Bradley IFV are taking part in real combat in Ukraine.

In this video, we show why their armor protection, firepower, and crew
survivability make them unmatched by Russia’s flagship T-90M.

Tank comparisons, destroyed columns, FPV drones, armored duels, and raw
frontline footage — all reveal why Western armor dominates the battlefield today.

#united24media #united24 #united24fightforfreedom #united24reports

🇺🇦 Firsthand news from the epicenter of global events

👋 Like our content? Become our sponsor and get even more: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCX-xHRN9CnoXto5gcPskANA/join
❗️News & Analysis: https://united24media.com/
👋 News on Ukraine and Ukrainian perspective on global security https://www.youtube.com/@United24News 
💪 When fighting for freedom, every penny counts. Donate to support Ukraine now on https://u24.gov.ua/uk 

✉️ For collaborations, ideas & questions: welcome@u24.media

comments.author: @BRIKS512
comments.text: I don't believe that anyone really believes in such poorly glued videos. Well, if we talk about tanks, the T-90M is much better suited for modern warfare. Firstly, the T-90M costs 3 times less than the Leopard 2A7, 3 times less than the Abrams M1A2 and 4 times less than the Challenger 2. Secondly, the T-90 has a better roof reservation, which occupies almost the entire upper part of the tank, which helps a lot in the fight against drones. That's what we've seen in practice. There is a video where the T-90M withstands 7 or 11 hits from airborne drones and still remains alive.

comments.author: @yavimayawurm9769
comments.text: In abrams the ammunition is stored in the rear part of the turret. When it ignites,  the energy is released through special hatches. In russian tanks due to the usage of autoloader, the ammunition is stored in a carousel around the turret so it all explodes launching the turret up in the air. Let's clarify that russian tanks were designed with a different tactics in mind where during cold war they assumed that they need a swarm of cheap small tanks that would push forward in waves regardless of the loses. If crew and vehicles are disposable, that would be a valid tactic at that time. But not when you use them as infantry support in small numbers. Those are zergs, not protons.

comments.text:
what i have seen from Ukraine Leopard Tank Crews, the capabilities are highly exceeding the written official numbers, the range for example exceeded the expectations by far with 100 percent accuracy over the stated numbers. As a German who worked for different ministries, i can tell you why you will see such a difference. You can't legally use numbers that could differ under some circumstances, if we say 100 percent accuracy up to X Km under perfect conditions, it won't be accepted. You have to either state number's for the different condition's or state the number that would work under every condition. 

Major differnces between Western Tank's and other's. Aside from being build with the crew in mind, you have way higher reserve speed, you don't need to turn and expose weaker parts of  the Armor. The Tanks are also more like Sniper's in field, the range and accuracy are greater.

comments.text: Eastern tanks are based on autoloaders, currently only the mighty T-14 Armata stores its ammunition in the back of the turret like it's western counterparts. Because munition for the autoloader is stored in the turret basked you can't create any safety modules that will save the crew, when it comes to western MBT's the ammunition is sitting in a metal can that has blast doors which redirect fire outside the vehicle making it safe for the crew. That means ALL tanks will suffer to drones but crews of the western ones will have a high chance of surviving and getting another one unlike the russians, but who cares if they can assign an untrained 18yo crew and send it for death?

comments.author: @tmaster3332
comments.text: 4:37 To be fair, it is entirely the fault of the auto loader design in these Russian tanks that causes this. Leopards and Abrams tanks can have a separated ammo compartment so that if it goes up in flames the chances of the crew being affected is minimal. But because the Russian tanks use a carousel type autoloader it is impossible to separate the crew entirely from the ammo (at least in most cases) because it's usually right behind or under the turret basket. Which is why they are famous turret launchers.

comments.author: @lewcrowley3710
comments.text: There are 3 different fire events.  One is the fuel.  It is diesel and stored both internally, and externally.  You can see it leaking on the ground , on fire, running downhill.  Fire suppression systems have a chance putting out this fire.  The next is 'gunpowder', or more correctly, a propellent fire.  This is signaled by the 'blowtorch flames' shooting out the tank.  Russian tanks have this inside the crew compartment, not isolated like the Abrams, etc.  Once this conflagration starts, it feeds on the next piece of ammunition.  The crew has mere moments to get out.  Fire suppression is not helpful.  The worst event is the detonation of the ammunition's projectiles.  The High Explosive in both HE and HEAT shells evidently can 'cook off' from both a propellent fire, or being actually struck by a penetration, or sympathetically from a drones explosion.  This leads to a triple event of fuel, propellant, and high explosives all getting consumed and the vehicle being ripped apart, and turrets, etc. flying about.  In WWII, the Soviets used very sensitive explosives in their shells.  I would bet they still do.  I don't see how any Russian can serve in an armored vehicle at this point.

comments.author: @richardcuttler7734
comments.text: At the time of Ukraine’s independence from the Soviet Union in 1991, Ukraine held the third largest nuclear arsenal in the world, including an estimated 1,900 strategic warheads, 176 intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs), and 44 strategic bombers. By 1996, Ukraine had returned all of its nuclear warheads to Russia in exchange for economic aid and security assurances, and in December 1994, Ukraine became a non-nuclear weapon state-party to the 1968 nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty (NPT). The last strategic nuclear delivery vehicle in Ukraine was eliminated in 2001 under the 1991 Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty (START). It took years of political maneuvering and diplomatic work, starting with the Lisbon Protocol in 1992, to remove the weapons and nuclear infrastructure from Ukraine.

comments.author: @stephenhall3515
comments.text:
The bias of this vlog is typical but did no favors to the Zelenskyy regime -- rather the opposite, especially as the non-president was so smug and sneering in his presentation. It can be viewed in full on many sites.
The Russian idea of a 3 day cease fire for the 80th anniversary of VE Day during a claimed 30 day sort of cease fire declared by Kiev, which even EU elite figures had no belief in, could be seen as equally unrealistic.
Given Kiev's thirst for headlines, the Kremlin cast several lures at once. The parade and days leading up to it, the cancellation/postponement of the Black Sea celebration and not using jamming of US and ESA satellites at the weapons factories at surface level. I was reminded of British tactics in late 1944 when dummy planes and armored vehicles were moved about a bit so Nazi recon photographs showed apparent assets in various stages of preparation/maintenance.
To be eve more convincing if Goering's remnants made attacks, the RAF used old oil and tyres to burn to confuse attackers and, above all, obscure large areas. Attacking aircraft were brought down or not to leave enough to reach home and confuse commanders more thoroughly. This less to carelessness in signaling and decryption became easier and regular RAF night bombing of Germany continued but USAAF and RCAF B-24s with Mustangs and Hurricanes making day attacks on retreating German forces, led by RAF Mosquito dawn marker aircraft in large quantities, some using new transponder marking instead of fire across large fronts.
In these days of drone use [given by the USA etc for defense] it was easy for Russia to predict where drones and long range rockets would be aimed at. 
The phrase "appropriate response" is not the same as equal response because Russia will not simply launch drones but use a mix of weapons for surgical strikes and where Kiev stores and even makes some drones as well as the armor repair hubs from the north, east, south and parallel to the Polish border import points.
Possibly, Russia will shorten the skirmishing time on the Pokrovsk front with quite cheap thermobaric bombing from OTH helicopters and Su-25s then the waiting armored columns will make for Dnipro city for talks but it is unlikely that its oblast will be added to the 'fraternal 4' for new capital reasons. Dnipro city is a good site for an administrative capital of Ukraine Mk 2.

The now even more weakened german army in moscow was now easier to defeat for even the ruzzians to complete the mission and they were able to save Moscow...Stalin later wrote in his memoirs, that "if it hadn't been for the United States and it's machines of war, ruzzia would have surely falled to the german army"...yes, that's how close it was. comments.text:
Well, for one thing, I'd bet that "massive drone wave" was a mostly intended as a test of Moskow's air defenses - older models that are past their "best sued by" dates, surplus, or otherwise unfit for frontline duty. Ukraine probably just wanted to light up all the radar sites so that, as the US did recently in Yemen, all sorts of electronic "ears" could map their GPS locations to within a meter, plus draining the Russians stockpiles of anti-air missiles in preparation for a HARD drone wave of "the best & brightest" smart drones during the May Day parade tomorrow (May 9th). I don't think this was the main attack; this was just a full scale test of the enemy's defenses in depth, to see what they'll be up against tomorrow.

Other people may have other thoughts & opinions, and that's ok with me. It would be a dull, monotonous, and thoroughly boring world if we all agreed on everything, all the time & everywhere. (What would we talk about over dinner?)

title: Russia-Ukraine peace talks end after less than 2 hours in Istanbul, officials say • FRANCE 24
description:
The first direct peace talks between Russia and Ukraine since Moscow’s 2022 invasion ended in under two hours, according to Turkey and a senior Ukrainian official. Kyiv accused Moscow of introducing “unacceptable demands,” including the withdrawal of Ukrainian forces from large areas of territory. Here's FRANCE 24's journalists analyses.
#Ukraine #peace

title: Putin To Punish Ukraine If Istanbul Talks Fail? Big Russian Military Reshuffle Sparks Speculation
description:
Just before critical Russia-Ukraine peace talks in Istanbul, Putin shocks the world by firing his land forces chief, Oleg Salyukov. The talks, originally scheduled for May 15, have now been pushed to Friday. Ukraine’s President Zelensky, already in Turkey, voiced concern over the delay. As new delegations prepare, all eyes are on Istanbul. Can diplomacy prevail amid reshuffles and high-level signals?


INTERNATIONAL NEWS


#Putin #Russia #Ukraine #PeaceTalks #Salyukov #MilitaryShakeup #Istanbul #Zelensky #Shoigu

title: Putin not attending war talks with Ukraine that he himself proposed
description: Vladimir Putin was not included in a list released by the Kremlin of who will attend discussions between Russia and Ukraine in Turkey. The talks were first proposed by Putin in response to the ceasefire-or-sanctions ultimatum given to Moscow by Ukraine’s European allies, when the leaders of Germany, France, Poland and the United Kingdom demanded that Russia accept a 30-day ceasefire proposal or face a new round of “massive” sanctions. #CNN #News

He comes back and gives a revised price lower than the original. Again you now offer half of the asking. He shakes his head - and so we go on until the buyer and seller agree through the salesman. Then outcomes the owner, takes the cash and offer the customer a cup of cardamom or hibiscus tea. In this Ukraine game we don’t know who is the seller and who is the customer. 시키신 대로 하여 유월절을 예비하였더라. 유월절을 예비했다면 지키는 장면을 봅시다 마태복음26:26~28 저희가 먹을 때에 예수께서 떡을 가지사 축복하시고 떼어 제자들을 주시며 가라사대 받아 먹으라 이것이 내 몸이라 하시고 또 잔을 가지사 사례하시고 저희에게 주시며 가라사대 너희가 다 이것을 마시라 이것은 죄사함을 얻게 하려고 많은 사람을 위하여 흘리는 바 나의 피 곧 언약의 피니라. 예수님께서 피를 흘리셨다면 십자가에서 피를 흘리셨습니다 그런데 유월절의 포도주를 십자가에서 흘리는 나의 피라고 예수님께서 말씀하셨습니다 그러므로 유월절의 떡은 십자가에 달리신 예수님의 몸이 되고 또 우리가 유월절의 떡과 포도주를 먹고 마시므로 영생하시는 예수님의 살과피를 먹고 마시므로 우리 또한 예수님과 한몸이 되여 영생을 얻게 되고 또 예수님께서는 유월절을 지켜 자신과 한몸된 우리에 죄를 위하여 십자가에서 희생에 피를 흘리심으로 우리에 죄가 용서받게 되는 것입니다 그러나 유월절을 지키지 않아 예수님과 한몸이 되지 않은 사람들은 예수님께서 십자가에서 흘리신 희생에 피가 그들과는 아무 상관이 없는 것입니다 로마서6:23 죄의 삯은 사망이니라. 죄로 말미암아 사망이 왔으니 우리가 유월절을 지켜 예수님과 한몸이 되여 죄사함을 받았으니 사망이 없어지고 영생을 얻게 되는 것입니다 그런데 세상에 교회들과 사람들은 죄사함을 받고 영생을 얻게 되는 새언약 유월절에 대하여 알지도 못하고 지키지도 안고 있습니다 단지 레오나르도 다빈치의 최후에 만찬이라고 알고 있을 뿐입니다 우리 머리에 손을 얹고 생각을 해봅시다 예수님께서 인류에 죄를 위하여 십자가에 매달려 희생에 피를 흘리심으로 죄사함을 받고 영생을 얻는 새언약 유월절을 세우셨는데 지키지도 안고 무조건 믿기만 하면 죄사함을 받고 영생 얻고 천국간다는 가르침은 마귀들의 마취약입니다 우선 유월절 새언약을 지키고 죄사함을 받고 영생을 얻고 그 다음에 믿음으로 구원을 받는 것이 옳은 믿음입니다 그리고 또 어느 거짓교회 목사들이나 신부들이 아무때나 떡과 포도주를 주면서 이것이 예수님의 살과피라고 하는 것은 절때 예수님의 살과피가 될수가 없습니다 그 이유는 에덴동산에 선악과가 독이 있어서 아담과 하와가 먹고 죽은 것이 아니라 하나님의 말씀에 먹으면 정녕 죽으리라(창세기2:16~17) 말씀하신 그 말씀에 능력때문에 먹고 죽은것 처럼 예수님께서 유월절의 떡과 포도주가 내 살과피라고 말씀하신 그 말씀에 능력으로 유월절의 떡과 포도주가 예수님의 살과피가 될수가 있는 것입니다 아무때나 먹고 마시는 떡과 포도주는 천만번을 먹고 마실지라도 그것은 예수님의 살과피가 될수가 없습니다(요한복음6:10~11,26~27) 누가복음22:15 이르시되 내가 고난을 받기 전에 너희와 함께 이 유월절 먹기를 원하고 원하였노라. 왜 예수님께서 유월절을 먹기를  원하고 원하였노라 말씀하셨냐면 유월절이 아니고서는 당신에 살과피를 우리에게 먹여 줄수가 없기 때문입니다 유월절은 성력으로 정월14일밤에 기념하는 절기입니다 에베소서3:4~6......이는 이방인들이 복음으로 말미암아 그리스도 예수안에서 함께 후사가 되고 함께 지체가 되고 함께 약속에 참예하는 자가 됨이라.여기 말씀을 보시면 복음으로 말미암아 그리스도와 함께 후사가 되고 지체가 되고 약속에 참여하는 자가 된다고 했습니다 그것이 바로 복음입니다 그 복음이 바로 새언약 유월절 날에 떡과 포도주를 먹고 마시므로 영생하시는 예수님의 살과피를 먹고 마시므로  예수님과 한몸이 되여 즉 예수님 지체가 됩니다 요한일서2:25 그가 우리에게 약속하신 약속이 이것이니 곧 영원한 생명이니라. 하나님의 약속은 바로 영영원한 생명입니다 약속에 참예하는 자가 되기위하여 우리는 새언약 유월절로 말미암아 죄사함을 받고 영생을 얻게 되는 것입니다 로마서8:16~18......자녀이면 또한 후사 곧 하나님의 후사요 그리스도와 함께한 후사니 우리가 그와 함께 영광받기 위하여 고난도 함께 받아야 될 것이니라 생각건대 현재의 고난은 장차 우리에게 나타날 영광과(천국에 영광) 족히 비교할 수 없도다. 우리가 새언약의 유월절날에 죄사함을 받고 영생을 얻고 천국에 후사가 될수가 있는 것입니다 죄사함을 받지 않고 영생을 얻지 못하고 어찌 우리가 천국에 후사가 될수 있겠습니까 다시말해 새언약의 유월절로 그리스도와 함께 지체가 되고 후사가 되고 지체가 되고 약속에 참여하는 자가 됨으로 사도바울이 자신을 복음의 일꾼이라 했고 새언약의 일꾼이라 말한것 입니다 즉 복음의 일꾼이 바로 새언약의 일꾼이기 때문입니다 줄여서 말한다면 복음이 바로 새언약입니다 데살로니가후서1:7~9......주 예수께서 저희 능력에 천사들과 함께 하늘로 부터 불꽃중에 강림하실 때에 하나님을 모르는 자들과 우리 주 예수의 복음을 복종치 않는 자들에게 형벌을 주시리니 이런 자들이 주의 얼굴과 그의 힘의 영광을 떠나 영원한 멸망의 형벌을 받으리라.여기 말씀에서 불꽃중에 강림하실때는 3차 핵 전쟁으로 이땅에 사는 자들을 심판하시는 때입니다 그리고 하나님을 모르는 자들 즉 복음이 새언약 이라는 것을 모르는 사람들입니다 그리고 주 예수의 복음에 복종치 않는 사람들이 바로 새언약 유월절을 지키지 않는 사람들입니다 그런 교회가 바로 거짓교회입니다 왜냐하면 죄사함을 주고 영생을 얻게 하는 새언약 유월절 진리가 없으면서 복음을 전한다고 하는 교회는 거짓말하는 단체이고 또 거짓선지자들입니다 YouTube에서 the church of God visitors from the angelic world 진리책자 내용을 들어보시고요 그리고 또 the passover and God's commandments 설교 말씀도 들어보시고요 우리 하나님의 교회(www.watv.org) comments.text:
Once again CNN has it wrong - please do some proper analysis. Putin did not propose to go to the talks himself but to send an exploratory team to Istanbul. As in normal diplomacy he is sending a team to work through discussions leading to a stoppage of combat eventually. Once all details are figured out, foreign ministers will meet and perhaps a ceasefire arranged and only after that, if peace is agreed, will heads of state meet. This is the correct process.

It was Zelensky who declared that he would go to Istanbul, but that he would not engage with the Russian delegation, but only with Putin - who was never going to attend anyway. Zelensky, who has no desire for peace unless he wins in negotiations what he is losing on the battlefield, knows that Putin will not turn up, will declare Putin does not want peace and will score a mere media victory (only in the West) while he continues to lose men and territory on the battlefield. It seems this war will only end on the battlefield.

comments.author: @cashaeleatemla
comments.text:
Putin and Zelensky have not met in person since December 2019. Russia and Ukraine last held direct negotiations in March 2022 in Istanbul, shortly after Moscow launched its full-scale invasion of its neighbour.

Fighting has raged in Ukraine since then. Russian forces have slowly expanded the amount of territory they control over the past year, mostly in the east of Ukraine.

Putin had initially called for direct talks between Russia and Ukraine in Turkey's largest city "without pre-conditions", before Zelensky announced that he would go in person and expected the Russian president to travel as well.

Putin's suggestion of direct talks in Istanbul followed Western powers' call for a 30-day ceasefire, after European leaders met in Kyiv on Saturday.

After Trump called for Ukraine to accept the offer on Sunday, Zelensky said he would travel there himself.

title: Russia's Checkmate, Zelensky Out of Options Now? Putin's Top Man Drops Final Peace Terms To Stop War
description:
A historic summit between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky could be on the horizon, as Moscow signals its willingness to meet if concrete agreements are reached in ongoing peace talks. Following the first direct negotiations between Russia and Ukraine since 2022-held in Istanbul and mediated by Turkey-Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov stated that a Putin-Zelensky meeting is possible, but only after both sides’ delegations finalize specific terms. Watch for more

title: BREAKING: Russia-Ukraine end peace talks after 2 hours, agree to exchange 1,000 prisoners
description:
The first direct peace talks between Russia and Ukraine since the early weeks of Moscow’s 2022 invasion ended Friday after less than two hours, and a senior Ukrainian official said the Russian side introduced new “unacceptable demands.” AP reports, before they adjourned, Kyiv and Moscow agreed to exchange 1,000 prisoners of war each, according to the heads of both delegations, in what would be their biggest such swap since the war began.

comments.text:
**War Between Russia and Poland: Historical Context**

The war between Russia and Poland lasted for 196 years — from the 15th to the 17th century. Formally, the conflict never truly ended, despite numerous truces that sometimes lasted 5, 10, or even 25 years. These truces were merely pauses in a single, prolonged war that continued until Russia achieved its goals.

This is important to take into account when understanding the historical specifics and when building any kind of strategy. Expecting that Russia will “grow tired” and retreat is a profoundly unhistorical forecast. Of course, history does include unique and unexpected cases — no one rules out the emergence of catastrophes or extraordinary events. But based on historical experience, this particular feature of Russian strategy deserves attention and respect.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Zelensky Urges Trump To Meet With Putin Happen | WION
description:
In a significant development, Russian President Vladimir Putin has offered Ukraine the opportunity to restart peace talks without preconditions, proposing Turkey as the meeting venue. In response, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has expressed a desire for a ceasefire and welcomed Putin to Turkey for dialogues. Both leaders have not met face-to-face since 2019, raising questions about the feasibility of these peace talks. 

#russia #ukraine #wion

WION The World is One News examines global issues with in-depth analysis. We provide much more than the news of the day. Our aim is to empower people to explore their world. With our Global headquarters in New Delhi, we bring you news on the hour, by the hour. We deliver information that is not biased. We are journalists who are neutral to the core and non-partisan when it comes to world politics. People are tired of biased reportage and we stand for a globalized united world. So for us, the World is truly One.

title: Russian drone attack on Ukraine bus kills nine, officials say | BBC News
description:
Local officials say nine people have been killed in a Russian drone attack on a civilian bus in north-eastern Ukraine.

The Sumy regional military administration said four other people were injured in the town of Bilopillia on Saturday morning as the bus travelled to the regional capital Sumy, close to Russia's border. 

The reported attack comes just hours after Russia and Ukraine held their first direct peace talks since 2022 - no breakthrough was achieved, although a swap of prisoners of war was agreed. 

Ukraine's national police described the bus attack as a "cynical war crime". Russia has not commented directly but said it had hit a "military staging area" in Sumy.

The American Empire started this war and the Russian Federation will inevitably finish it. This 11 year conflict began when the CIA orchestrated a violent political coup which overthrew the democratically elected leader Victor Yanukovych and installed a US friendly illegitimate ultra nationalist regime with ties to far right paramilitaries such as the Azov Battalion and Svoboda in 2014. This coup split the country into a brutal civil war between the new US friendly government of Kiev and Donbas oblasts of Donetsk, Luhansk and Crimea friendly to Moscow that didn't recognise the new regime, resulting in over 15,000 civilian casualties and 50,000 fleeing into Russia. President Poroshenko never honoured the Minsk peace accords that was brokered between Moscow and the EU and even former German chancellor Angela Merkel admitted in an interview that Minsk was just a stalling tactic to flood Ukraine full of NATO weaponry for their assault on the donbas but for something much more dangerous. To the Russians, they could never allow Ukraine to become a NATO member, but remain neutral. They would never allow the Crimean peninsula to be used by the US navy. This was always a red line for the Russians who always demanded Ukrainian neutrality for their national security concerns going back to the times of Baker and Gorbachev who agreed that NATO should never expand any further east of Germany regardlessof their security treaty with Ukraine. Obviously these treaties were broken due to aggressive NATO expansion  after the cold war. Even Putin in the early 2000s asked for NATO membership. After all NATO was created to counter the Soviet Union and the cold war ended, but Putin was refused because of the old NATO docturine, " keep the US up, Germans down and the Russians out. " If Russia was a member then what was the point of NATO continuing without a constant enemy and obviously the profits of the US military industrial complex aka the US economy. When the Kiev regime never honoured the Minsk accords and donbas autonomy, Donetsk and Luhansk became independent states and called for direct Russian military assistance. Zelensky campaigned on peace, but when he gained power he quickly realised that he had zero control over the Ukrainian military and the ultra nationalist paramilitaries fighting in the east. In fact these Azov forces publicly humiliated Zelensky and even Ukrainian commanders admitted in the Kiev Independent that they " take their orders from Washington." And even the paramilitaries were on the payroll of the CIA as revealed by the LA times. Zelensky tried to negotiate peace but even his diplomats were suspicious assassinated some believing by the SBU. And when he tried to negotiate a ceasefire in April 2022, the UK prime minister Boris Johnson personally flew to Kiev and scuttled the peace talks  negotiations mediated by Turkey and Israel, promising Zelensky what he couldn't deliver. Full NATO membership. Zelensky soon realised that he was just a puppet of the American Empire, a poster boy for NATO to turn Ukraine into Afghanistan 2.0 where the Ukrainians will be used a cannon fodder for the Washington neocon project of trying to destabilise Russia and eventually balkanise Russia into weaker demilitarised microstates ripe for western plunder. But mainly for war profits for the US military industrial complex. Wash money out of the NATO tax basis and into the hands of the transnational security elite. To the Russians this was a direct threat to their  national security. And given Putin the excuse to conduct the SMO and annex the regions constitutionally into the Russian Federation. The objectives was clear. Secure the donbas and Crimea and create a buffer zone and then demilitarise Ukraine of NATO. Ukraine now is a failed state. Zelensky is no longer president of Ukraine. His presidential constitutional term has expired back in May 2024 and since then he declared himself the unelected de-facto ruler of Ukraine, installed martial law, arrested the main opposition party leaders and banned 11 political parties. He has arrested journalists, banned several news media organisations and consolidated the rest into his own state media apparatus. He has allowed the ultra nationalists to run amok within the Ukrainian military and allowed his SBU to round up untrained men and throw them on the front lines at the Russian war machine. The most disturbing fact was he allowed the SBU to set up a international kill list website called Mirotvorec which targets dissenters to the war such as politicians, activists, journalists and musicians. And a CBS report collaboration with the WaPo and New York Times revealed how the Ukrainian military top brass were skimming NATO money and weaponry and selling it to the international illegal arms trade markets. 
This conflict has not only devastated Ukraine, but economically devastated the EU when the German government allowed the US military to directly destroy their own nord stream pipeline infrastructure with Russia in a sabotage operation revealed by pulitzer prize winner journalist Seymour Hersh, for American expensive LNG and refined Russian oil and gas via India. Well, thanks to the US and Zelensky, Ukraine will have a very tiny population, so a tiny country would be appropriate. Trump and his son-in-law could make it into a casino resort for the degenerates who own the world. A sort of kinky new Switzerland.

Blackrock thinks it owns most of the land in what the West thinks of as Ukraine. And Trump thinks he owns its rare Earth metals and minerals, but Zelensky also sold that stuff to the UK and probably others.

And Zelensky had no right to sell anything. 

Folks need to stop joking around here. This map is not a Russian government
map, but it is a sensible one, allocating the oblasts essentially by their dominant ethnicities. The Russians will end up having to settle who gets what, because no one else is being honest and because Russians look after Russians. Putin will see to it that Russians (including Transnistria), Moldovans, and Hungarians have fuel, and he will have to landlocked the rump Ukrainian state to keep everyone safe. 

Trump can pretend to be a disinterested party, but the US started and has funded the conflict, and Trump missed his chance to dump the dirty project, so it is his war now and he has lost. 

The only reason the US is still squabbling is to protect BlackRock’s interest, which is what Trump did with the Panama Canal.

If Ukraine unconditionally surrendered right now, it would save many lives. It could probably keep the “Polish” section. Nobody wants those oblasts anyway.

comments.author: @azazeldemon7779
comments.text:
It would be nice to have Lviv in Poland again, but we will never go with Russia against Ukraine. If there was a possibility of buying Lviv back or, for example, exchanging it for Chełm or Przemyśl, Ukraine knows where to contact us. From the more distant areas of Ukraine, such as Volhynia, we only care about the bones of victims of massacres by Ukrainian nationalists, which we want to bury. We do not want these lands even if they paid us. It would be very convenient for Russia to antagonize Poles and Ukrainians against each other again, but we have already been through this. Despite my sentiment for Lviv, I would never want the Polish army to attack Ukraine. If it could be arranged diplomatically, then great, if not, then it should be respected and that's it.

Why would we dismantle Ukraine with Russia, which would then start to pressure us and vassalize us? This is nonsense, and we know Russia too well to go for it. And I am sure that the Romanians have the same approach. I do not say anything about the Hungarians because they and Slovakia are ridiculous countries. By the way, Slovakia is shouting very loudly for a country built from the Czech Republic, Poland and Hungary. Maybe some partition should be done here? Despite personal dislike for Hungary, the fact is that our nations are friendly and a common border in Slovakia would be fine for us. It's funny that Slovakia is going with a country that has claims to their lands (Hungary).

I will also emphasize one thing. Russia offered us these territories after the collapse of communism and there was a sounding out of Poland whether it would go with Russia against Ukraine around 2009. We refused in both cases. I will not be false because yes, it would be nice to have Lviv in Poland, but only if there was such an option and Ukraine did it voluntarily through diplomacy. But if it meant antagonism between us again, then this is a price that is not worth it. Ukraine must be between us and Russia. And if they were to give us Lviv hypothetically, then it would be nice to have compensation, for example in Rostov-on-Don and those areas. And it is worth reminding the Muscovites that if they are so honorable and want to give us back our former territories, then let them let Belarus go free and give us and Lithuanians Królewiec for division and Smolensk. These were also our territories, so let them be consistent.

1. Poland has nothing to claim; otherwise, Turkey could claim the Balkans and Greece on the same _'historical'_ grounds, let alone Russia claim Poland, Finland and the Baltic dwarves and Italy claim Western Europe.

comments.author: @D.S.handle
comments.text:
Poland annexing any Ukrainian territory is something that is extremely hard to imagine. Recognizing Ukraine’s territory in full was practically an unquestionable foreign policy of any Polish government since the moment Poland become free from the Soviet control. The idea of relinquishing Poland’s claim over the Galicia and Volhynia, that were annexed into the Soviet Ukraine after the WWII, was thought out by the Polish emigres for, among other reasons, a way to settle the question of Poland’s Western borders that similarly moved to the West into the previously German-controlled territory after the war. No less importantly, Polish intellectuals saw a need to have a strong Ukraine as a way to counter a potential threat from Russia. (Look up Juliusz Mieroszewski and Jerzy Giedroyc)

From time to time one can read news about Ukraine and Poland arguing with each other about their shared history, I know that history does not like hypotheticals, but I think it is nothing in comparison to what these relations could have been without the Polish-Ukrainian reconciliation that has happened throughout the years. You got to remember that prior to that in the XX century the Polish-Ukrainian conflicts were brutal, there was an enormous amount of mutual animosity.

As always the footage comes with detailed commentary and structure to add more meaningful context to the events and provide documentary, educational, and scientific value.

Truly cannot stomach other westerners who blindly support Ukraine because the Blackrock funded war profiteering media tells them to. No balls. No integrity. What kind of country outlaws a language and punishes citizens who speak it, under threat of imprisonment and execution? Won't even get into Azov batllion and Right Sector. It just blows my mind. We shouldn't be supporting either side, but praying for peace. If you really care about the Ukranian people you would support an end to this warm and let the Russian speaking territories govern themselves, or join Russia if that's what they want. It is clearly the will of Dontesk and Lugansk to be in Russia, so why force them to be Ukranian? Crimea is a no brainer, they are Russian speaking Tatars, yet we have westerners saying "Free Crimea".

Stop spreading propoganda and deception, there is SO much deception about this conflict and you people are just hypnotized to it, and pick sides while dehumanizing the other. These are human beings.
